snippet: Thieves used the Swift network to steal $81 million from Bangladesh’s central bank in February, raising concerns about vulnerabilities within the system.
abstract: Sophisticated banking system known as Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication, or Swift, acknowledges that thieves who breached its network to steal $81 million from Bangladesh's account at Federal Reserve Bank of New York in February had made similar attempts at other banks in past; admission raises questions about security of banking system and points to growing sophistication on part of thieves.
lead_paragraph: Thieves used the Swift network to steal $81 million from Bangladesh’s central bank in February, raising concerns about vulnerabilities within the system.

headline.main: Hackers’ $81 Million Sneak Attack on World Banking
headline.print_headline: An $81 Million Sneak Attack on the World Banking System
